main_definition: To have been chosen by a vote or election to hold an office, position, or membership in a group.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The process of voting for someone to hold a particular role or position.
meanings_and_examples.example: During the general elections, citizens go to polling stations to elect their government representatives.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Being chosen by others through an election to serve in a specific office or role.
meanings_and_examples.example: After winning the mayoral race, John was elected as the city's new mayor.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A group of individuals who are selected for a particular purpose through voting.
meanings_and_examples.example: The members of the board were all elected by shareholders during the annual meeting.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To officially select someone to fulfill a role or position after an election has taken place.
meanings_and_examples.example: Once re-elected, she was appointed as the new ambassador to France.
